content:
Hi All

The Vocabulary Work Group (Vocab WG) will vote on a block of FHIR JIRA tickets at the Friday, January 21, 2022, Q2 quarter of the WGM.

The list of tickets are described in a spreadsheet named 20220107_JanWGMBlockVoteLevel0.xlsx, linked in the Vocab WG Friday Q2 agenda (https://confluence.hl7.org/display/VOC/Jan+2022+-+HL7+Virtual+WGM+Meeting+Agenda+for+Vocabulary) slot.

The tickets are either duplicates, no longer valid because processes have changed, not set correctly, or are not solvable by Vocab WG.

If you wish to exclude one of the tickets from the block vote, please respond via this Zulip thread or attend the block vote meeting.

Thank you,
Vocab WG Co-chairs

I can't find a spreadsheet with that name in the agenda. I could find a blockVote spreadsheet, but at least one of the links is an issue that's already been resolved - so it's not appropriate to be voted. As well, the spreadsheet doesn't indicate what the dispositions are, which isn't super friendly. Finally, you should specifically "@" those whose issues are being block voted so that their attention is drawn to review and make sure they're ok with the proposed dispositions.
Resolution is in the attached spreadsheet. Submitters of Vocab block votes: @Lloyd McKenzie @Grahame Grieve @Russell McDonell @Rick Geimer @Rob Hausam @Alexander Henket
@Carmela Couderc where's the attached spreadsheet
On the agenda page provided in Reuben's original post

The spreadsheet needs to be linked to here and it needs to be cleaner than the one I found - which included stuff that wasn't to be voted. Please create a new spreadsheet that specifically lists what's included in the block vote and clearly shows the issue, the submitter and the proposed resolution.
@Reuben Daniels - what's happening with this block vote? I haven't yet seen a proper list of the issues and proposed resolutions posted here.
